FuncDef:
The port link-type command configures a link type on an Ethernet interface.
The undo port link-type command restores the default link type. The port link-type command configures a link type on an Ethernet interface. The undo port link-type command restores the default link type. The default link type of an interface is access.
ParentView: Layer 2 100GE interface view,Layer 2 10GE interface view,Layer 2 200GE interface view,25GE-L2 view,400GE-L2 view,Layer 2 50GE interface view,Layer 2 Eth-Trunk interface view,Layer 2 GE interface view,Interface group view

ParaDef.Info:
Configures the link type of an interface as hybrid.
-

Configures the link type of an interface as trunk.
-

Configures the link type of an interface as dot1q-tunnel.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
-

Configures the link type of an interface as access.
-

ExtraInfo: Different types of interfaces are applicable to different scenarios:
